intro: Miconia acunagalei, commonly known as the red miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
